introduction.p: It may seem silly at first to have an entire chapter dedicated to the topic of counting at this stage of your mathematical development. After all, how hard could it be?

investigation.introduction: Let's consider a few "counting problems" to get a better sense of what may actually be involved in this seemingly simple task of counting.

statement.p: How many squares are in the figure below?

statement.p: How many dots are in the figure below?

solution.p: While we could also approach this question by enumerating the individual dots, another approach uses a concept called subitizing. This particular arrangement of dots is common and familiar to anyone who has played games that involve rolling a die. So we recognize this particular arrangement of dots and associate it with prior knowledge that there are five dots.

task.statement: Tommy has 4 pants and 6 shirts. How many different outfits can he make from these?

solution.p: Since an outfit consists of a pants and a shirt, we need to count the number of ways we can pair each pants with each shirt. This gives us 4 \cdot 6 = 24 possible outfits.
